location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter to William Hornby, President and Governor, Council at Bombay, from John Beaumont and George Green at Bushire

mods.abstract: The letter confirms the re-establishment of the Residency in Bushire and the appointment of John Beaumont as Resident and George Green to its management. The letter discusses a number of finanical and administrative matters and includes a list of woolens/cloths sold. It reports that Sheikh Sadoon (brother of Sheikh Nassir and governor of Bushire in his absence) has requested details of woolen sales. It also notes that a letter was received from Shaikh Nassir which noted that a delegation had left Bussora [Basra] for Schiras [Shiraz] to give presents to Carim Cahn [Karim Khan] in hope of resolving their differences with the Persians.
